channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Office staff stay home despite end of Wales restrictions
item.description: Hybrid working could be one of the long-term legacies of the pandemic and lockdown restrictions.

item.title: Covid: Will Wales' GP surgeries go 'back to normal'?
item.description: GPs say false accusations they are shut and should "get back to work" are affecting morale.

item.title: Covid: Porthcawl Elvis Festival boss fears 'legal minefield'
item.description: Organisers must carry out risk assessments and take measures to minimise the spread of Covid.

item.title: Cefn Mawr disused chapel set to reopen after eight years
item.description: The Ebenzer became a community centre in 2008, but lacked visitors and closed in 2013.

item.title: Eglwysbach rescue: Man with broken hip airlifted to hospital
item.description: Mountain rescue says the 70-year-old was slipping in and out consciousness when he was found.

item.title: Booker Prize: Novel inspired by last hanging at Cardiff prison
item.description: Mahmood Mattan's wrongful conviction has inspired a novel longlisted for the Booker Prize.

item.title: Covid: Student 'crying for water' in Majorca quarantine hotel
item.description: A student nurse says her treatment at a Covid quarantine hotel in Majorca has been "like prison".

item.title: Covid in Wales: Three more deaths and 864 new cases
item.description: It means there have been 5,626 deaths and 246,205 positive tests during the pandemic in Wales.

item.title: 'Superb' Price wins historic boxing gold
item.description: Britain's Lauren Price becomes the first Welsh fighter to win an Olympic boxing gold medal, beating China's Li Qian in the women's middleweight final.

item.title: River pollution in Wales: Swimmers warned over sewage
item.description: Waterways have become increasingly popular places to swim, especially with pools closed in lockdown.

item.title: Bridge-collapse fears trigger alert for Bassaleg homeowners
item.description: Temporary accommodation is available for those who decide to leave, the council says.

item.title: Covid: Pubs busy as most rules end in Wales
item.description: Social distancing ends, but face masks are still needed in shops and on public transport.

item.title: Pollution: 'This is my coffin, this is why I swim with it'
item.description: Wild swimmer Angela Jones says she hopes her specially designed coffin will catch attention.

item.title: Covid: Excitement as nightclubs reopen in Wales
item.description: Most of Wales' remaining Covid rules are lifted as nightclubs reopen in alert level zero.

item.title: Covid: How will we adjust to life without so many rules?
item.description: With Wales moving into alert level zero, an expert says behaviours learnt in the pandemic might last.

item.title: Covid: Hospitality rules change after '18 months of hell'
item.description: Two-metre distancing and masks will not be legally required in pubs and restaurants from Saturday.

item.title: Covid: Live music in Wales resumes with Feeder gig
item.description: Despite outdoor restrictions being relaxed weeks ago, the venue is still taking precautions.

item.title: Covid: First minister outlines end of most restrictions
item.description: Wales is "on the final lap of emerging from the pandemic", Mark Drakeford says.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Lauren Price targets more Olympic success after boxing gold
item.description: Olympic boxing champion Lauren Price is likely to go for gold again in Paris rather than turn professional.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Alun Wyn Jones defends right to be 'emotional' after loss
item.description: British and Irish Lions captain Alun Wyn Jones defends his right to be "overly emotional" after his spectacular injury return ended in a narrow series loss to South Africa.

item.title: Gareth Bale: Wales forward misses penalty on return to Real Madrid action
item.description: Gareth Bale plays in Real Madrid's friendly with AC Milan after returning to Spain following his loan spell at Tottenham Hotspur.

item.title: 'You could hear a pin drop' - reporting on the unique Tokyo Olympics
item.description: From masks and quarantine to empty seats and daily Covid-19 tests, this is what it was like to report on a unique Olympic Games.

item.title: One Day Cup: Glamorgan thrash Nottinghamshire Outlaws by eight wickets
item.description: Glamorgan move to the verge of the One-Day Cup knockout stages after thrashing an inexperienced Notts Outlaws side by eight wickets.

item.title: Covid: Gweithwyr yn aros adref er i'r cyfyngiadau godi
item.description: Y gred yw na fydd pawb yn dychwelyd yn llawn amser i'r swyddfa fyth eto.

item.title: Ymateb cymysg wedi penwythnos cyntaf lefel rhybudd sero
item.description: I nifer roedd y penwythnos yn ddechrau newydd, ond pryderon hefyd wrth i Gymru lacio'r cyfyngiadau.

item.title: Golygu lluniau'n 'achosi problemau iechyd meddwl'
item.description: Rhybudd y gall golygu lluniau arwain at gynnydd yn y nifer o bobl sy'n dioddef o anhwylderau meddyliol.

item.title: Pump uchafbwynt yr Eisteddfod AmGen
item.description: Er fod yna ddim Maes, roedd hi dal yn Steddfod a hanner.

item.title: Seiclwr o Abertawe yn 'un i'w gwylio' am y dyfodol
item.description: Dywed Eluned King ei bod wedi elwa o'r cyfnod clo a'i bod yn gobeithio seiclo yng Ngemau'r Gymanwlad yn 2022.
